title: NIST: 2023/2024 NVD Budget

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NIST: 2023/2024 NVD Budget
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The amount of money allocated by NIST to fund the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) (reference: https://nvd.nist.gov/) for the 2023 and 2024 calendar years. This includes personnel, materials, computers, and applicable expenditures such as travel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

title: 2007 Prg "Glamour" Infection at Dept. of Transportation

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records you may hold on the ransomware, computer virus, trojan horse, malware, or malicious software named "NTOS", "Prg" or "Wsnpoem". It is also known as "Glamorous", "GLAMOUR", "Zeus", or "Zbot". I am seeking records from the years 2006-2008.

Reuters reported on an infection/hack/theft in an August 9, 2007 piece titled "Hackers steal U.S. govt, corporate data from PCs". This article is available at:

https://www.reuters.com/article/us-internet-attack/hackers-steal-u-s-government-corporate-data-from-pcs-idUSN1638118020070717/

Reuters was referencing a company called Prevx which wrote a blog article on July 16, 2007 titled "Ransomware... Holding Corporate America Ransom!". This post is archived at:

https://web.archive.org/web/20071022014355/http://www.prevx.com/blog/31/Ransomware-Holding-Corporate-America-Ransom.html

The article says that the U.S. Dept. of Transportation was a victim:

"Translating the logfiles on the server to meaningful data was quite easy, ...

152.120.156.x, US, Maryland, Bladensburg, U.S. Dept. of Transportation"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dennis Schwarz

title: CPS: Transportation x Disability Category x Race

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Transportation x Disability Category x Race
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide records sufficient to show:

1. The total number of students who check "Yes" in the Transportation section of an IEP in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024. Please provide this data by disability category broken down by race per disability category. 

2. The total number of students who have IEPs in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024 to date by disability category broken down by race per disability category.

3. The total number of students who have Behavior Intervention Plans in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024 to date by disability category broken down by race.

4. The total number of students who have Behavior Intervention Plans and check "Yes" in the Transportation section of an IEP in school years 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024 to date by disability category broken down by race by disability category. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all records related to the Title IX annual report announced by Brian Sandoval on Oct. 13, 2023  (Reference to the related article: https://www.unr.edu/nevada-today/news/president-messages/2023-10-13-information-and-updates-on-the-office-of-equal-opportunity-and-title-ix )
- Any and all communications regarding the creation and development of the Title IX report
- Spreadsheets or documents on the raw data from the report, provided as a .pdf or .csv file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

title: NSCA - Gidley

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: NSCA - Gidley
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

records containing the following keywords and email domains:

•	“National School Chaplain Association”
•	“NSCA”
•	“@campuschaplains.org”
•	“campus chaplains”
•	Rocky Malloy
•	Wallbuilders
•	David Barton
•	Tim Barton
•	“@wallbuilders.org”
•	“@wallbuilders.com”
•	Audrea Decker
•	audrea@profamily.com 
•	“@profamily.com”

The scope of this request includes the following legislator:

-	Rep. Mark Gidley

The search for records should include sent and received emails and any other electronic records including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar records, text messages, and messages on messaging platforms such as Slack and Microsoft Teams. The search for email records should also include any email accounts used to conduct official business, including personal email addresses such as a "gmail" or "yahoo" account. 

Please include any attachments to those records and other materials enclosed with those records at the time they were transmitted. For instance, for an email that is responsive to our request, please include all prior messages sent or received in that email chain, as well as any attachments to the email.

The search for records may be limited to records created, sent, or received between January 1, 2023, through the date of your final response. If the legislator assumed office after January 1, 2023, please narrow the search for records to the date on which the legislator assumed office through to the date of your final response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Karen Goll.

title: NFE Gas-Fired Power Plants and Generators

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NFE Gas-Fired Power Plants and Generators
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that the EPA has started accruing information about a gas pipeline in Puerto Rico by New Fortress Energy: https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/locales/notas/la-epa-desconoce-sobre-propuesto-gasoducto-en-la-central-san-juan/. At the same time, much has been written about how possible health hazards created by LNG plants: https://earthjustice.org/experts/jordan-luebkemann/puerto-rico-lng-terminal-is-a-ticking-time-bomb. Reports also show that EPA has been negotiating with New Fortress Energy about the use of 14 generators: https://www.elvocero.com/gobierno/no-cuquen-a-la-epa-advierte-exdirector-de-divisi-n-del-caribe-tras-incumplimientos/article_6cef5c36-e70c-11ee-9910-47d3d7c05518.html

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Communications, messages, emails, and attachments within your agency concerning the authorization of multiple gas-fired power plants in Puerto Rico run directly by New Fortress Energy or by their subsidiary Genera PR. 

2) Communications, messages, emails, and attachments between your agency and other parties consulted in the process of authorizing the construction, installation, and operation of gas-fired power plants or generators (including but not limited to: FEMA, Genera PR, New Fortress Energy, Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority, and Puerto Rico Bureau of Energy).

3) Any presentations, videos, audios, and memoranda used to educate employees or concerned parties about the construction, installation, and operation of gas-fired power plants or generators. Please include any notes made in preparation, during, and after these presentations. 

4) Any records concerning the regulatory structures and legal guidelines for allowing gas-fired power plants or generators to operate without a "Prevention of Significant Deterioration" (PSD) permits. 

5) Any environmental impact statements (EIS), air pollution control plans, health studies, emission controls, and other studies concerned with the impact of gas-fired power plants or generators in Puerto Rico.

Keywords: "Genera PR," "New Fortress Energy," "Clean Air Act," "Puerto Rico," "PREB," "Puerto Rico Energy Bureau," "NFE," "PREPA, "AEE,"

This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2023 and the time this request is processed. In the case that there are multiple responsive documents, please send them to me on a rolling basis.

This request is not made for commercial purposes and any records obtained will be shared with the general public. I am a member of the news media and these records will be used in the course of reporting about the use of gas-fired power plants in Puerto Rico and their effect on air pollution.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: Boston Police Department Internal Affairs Compliment and Complaint

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Boston Police Department Internal Affairs Compliment and Complaint
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Boston Police Department Internal Affairs Compliment and Complaints filed for the year 2018. Specifically, we request an extract of the records to include the following columns:
- Incident number
- Officer name
- Officer City of Boston ID (6-digits)
- Report narrative

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rachel Young

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: ALPR datasharing information - Whittier CA Police Dept
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

 Information related to Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) data sharing. 1) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data; 2) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data; 3) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information; 4) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information;

*Records obtained from other agencies show the Whittier Police Department shares ALPR data with other agencies through Vigilant Solutions.  IF WPD is still a Vigilant Solutions customer, that program is capable of easily producing a report with the requested information.  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Greg Buhl

title: Whittier Misconduct Disclosures to LA District Attorney

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Whittier Misconduct Disclosures to LA District Attorney
communications.communication:
Dear Whittier Police Department,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting the following records:

-A copy of the Whittier PD’s response(s) to Los Angeles District Attorney Gascon’s 2021 request related to officer misconduct infromation.  The request made individually to all law enformecent agenies in Los Angeles County is described in this article, www.latimes.com/california/story/2021-06-20/few-la-police-agencies-have-given-gascon-dishonest-cop-names

I am requesting any letter or email sent in reply ans well as any data transmitted. 
I would imagine most of such data should be covered by SB 1421. This request is for the data as it was produced to the LA District Attorney, with any redactions required by SB 1421.  

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA.
Greg Buhl

title: Use of Force with GBI reports - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Use of Force with GBI reports - Whittier CA Police Dept
communications.communication:
Hello:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports, interviews, or similar investigative material in the department’s possession related to investigated Use of Force incidents involving WPD officers that caused Great Bodily Injury as defined by the state legislature (Injuries requiring 10 or more sutures and/or staples, Broken bones, All head injuries, Any injury deemed as serious. “Serious bodily injury” means injuries that involve a substantial risk of death, unconsciousness, protracted and obvious disfigurement, or protracted loss or impairment of the function of a bodily member or organ.)  Apologies if you already have this information posted to your website to comply with SB 1421 but I do not seem to be able to find it posted. 


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

*The requested documents will be made available to the general public via Muckrock, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a published citizen-journalist with articles in the Long Beach Beachcomber and on FORTHE.org. My research has been featured by the Los Angeles Times, Long Beach Post, Knock-LA, and other local publications.

Sincerely,

Gregory Buhl
lead researcher at CheckLBPD.org

title: Civil Asset Forfeitture - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Civil Asset Forfeitture - Whittier CA Police Dept
communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting the following records:

-Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts and seizures made by the WPD, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the WPD receives a share under the MOUs the department have in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

-Any annual reports produced on the WPD civil asset forfeiture program.

-Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the WPD Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the WPD.

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.

The time period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA.

Greg Buhl
Lead Researcher at CheckLBPD.org

title: Alan Todd May (Cobb County Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to the investigation of Alan May Todd in 1990 and 1991.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katie King

title: ES - MA/FNB

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: ES - MA/FNB
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show: Any correspondence, including emails, to and from Erika Saltzman with the words 'mutual aid' or references to Food Not Bombs,  from September 1, 2023 to the date this request is processed. Please include emails where Erika is cc'ed or bcc'ed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin
